title: George Burrell (rugby union)
text:
George "Dod" Burrell (21 January 1921 – 28 July 2001) was a <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He later became an international referee and president of the <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Union">Scottish Rugby Union</a>.
Rugby Union career.
Amateur career.
He played club rugby for <a href="Gala%20RFC">Gala</a>.
During the war he played for the 6th Battalion of the King's Own Scottish Borderers, his army side. He captained the squad and they won the British Army championship title.
Provincial career.
He played for <a href="South%20of%20Scotland%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">South of Scotland District</a>.
International career.
Burrell was capped four times as a <a href="Fullback%20%28rugby%20union%29">fullback</a> for Scotland between 1950 and 1951.
Referee career.
On retiring from playing he took up refereeing and refereed two international matches – one each in the <a href="1958%20Five%20Nations%20Championship">1958 Five Nations Championship</a> and <a href="1959%20Five%20Nations%20Championship">1959 Five Nations Championship</a>.
Administrative career.
He was assistant manager of the 1970 Scotland tour to Australia and took over as manager when <a href="Hector%20Monro%2C%20Baron%20Monro%20of%20Langholm">Hector Monro</a> had to return to Britain to fight a General Electio
Burrell also managed the <a href="1975%20Scotland%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20New%20Zealand">1975 Scotland rugby union tour of New Zealand</a> and the <a href="1977%20British%20Lions%20tour%20to%20New%20Zealand">1977 British Lions tour to New Zealand</a>
Burrell joined the SRU committee and served from 1968 to 86.
He was President of the <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Union">Scottish Rugby Union</a> in 1985–86.
Military career.
He served with the King's Own Scottish Borderers during the war. He was wounded in Normandy in 1944.
He was a company sergeant in the mortar platoon.
Death.
He died at the Borders General Hospital in Melrose.
